name: GDG Riga Meetup:  Digital Marketing: Tool to Reach your Users!
description_no_html: Agenda for the Meetup: Jānis Birģelis, Data Team Leader at Infinitum8 will present"Plan and Measure your Product Ahead with Digital Marketing". The talk will focus on how to think about complex marketing/content/measurements and what phases to prepare for in the client cycle. Jānis is one of the 5 Google Certified Trainers in Latvia. Working closely with others he offers a Web Analytics courses for young and experienced entrepreneurs. During his 3 years experience he was helping others to better understand data and being critical about data interpretations locally and over the world. Kārlis Kalniņš, Google Adwords / Analytics Certified Partner will present "How to Define a Digital Marketing Strategy Plan for your Product" Using digital marketing without a strategic approach is still commonplace. Save Your time and resources by actionable strategy. Kārlis successfully managed over 100 small,medium and large client digital marketing accounts for 3,5 years

name: GDG Meetup: Optimizing your Product
description_no_html: We're back with our Meetup format: two talks from two awesome speakers! This time we are visiting OK.ru with two talks on optimizing their products both on the backend and mobile. - First one from Vitaly Kulikov on Tips and tricks of highly loaded product management (RUS): This talk is about life of our products. It's about decisions we made, and the way this decisions guide us today. Talk will cover many aspects starting from choosing technological stack, up to monitoring production environment. - Second talk from Kirill Popov on Working with images on Android (RUS): I will tell you why we are migrated to Fresco. Why it fits our requirements? How is it works? And how to use it better?
venue__address: Pblc Biznesa Centrs , SIA - 23 Ulbrokas iela, Riga

name: Workshop: Firebase - rule all platforms
description_no_html: During this workshop you will explore possibilities of the Firebase in following platforms: iOS, Android and Web (JS). So, if you are one of these - come to the workshop, bring your teammates and let's hack together! This time format will be really interesting, we will split into groups with developer from each platform and try to bring a truly cross-platform app during the event with Firebase as a backend.

name: Workshop: League of Graphs
description_no_html: In this show-and-tell session we’ll find out how Neo4j can make us a professional League of Legends player. First, we’ll import game data into a Neo4j graph. Then we will push the limits of Cypher to uncover hidden secrets that lie in the depth of LoL. Which champions perform best as allies? What is the most effective strategy to advance your champion? What enemy team setup is the most dangerous? This session covers a rarely seen graph domain (gaming) and will provide you will solid, factual advice on how to play LoL.
venue__address: UNITY Business Centre, Vienības gatve 109, Riga

name: Workshop: Dockerization
description_no_html: This one you really do not want to miss. During this workshop all of you will have one common goal. Only together you will make an application successfully up and running. You will write Dockerfiles, building images, configuring Docker Compose, even work with Docker Registry. Be ready. It will be very active.

name: I/O Extended 2016 Retrospective
description_no_html: On this event we will have a retrospective of all the news during I/O event. We will show something, that was only on the backstage. Also come and grab some swag ;) Join us!

name: I/O Extended 2016 Riga
description_no_html: Join us at Google I/O Extended, watch a Google I/O Keynote life stream, discuss the news and eat some snacks in the process. Friendly and Googly atmosphere guaranteed! Some wild guessed on big announcements: Android N, Android Wear, Android Auto, Project Ara, Self-driving cars, Google Chrome, Smart home, Virtual reality, Project Fi.

name: Workshop: A glimpse into TypeScript
description_no_html: During this workshop we'll try out TypeScript: a promising technology that brings the power of strict typing into JavaScript. This session will include a brief introduction and a walkthrough of all the main features of TS followed by a practical workshop where we'll set up a simple frontend project. Since we're actually going to write code on the workshop, please take your laptops with you. You'll need your favourite IDE (Webstorm, IDEA or the free Visual Studio Code will do just fine) and the latest version of Node and Npm. We'll set up the rest

name: Workshop: Create a terminal chat application in Go
description_no_html: The workshop aims to focus on the language’s key features. During the event we are going to write a simple chat program consisting of a number of views representing a list of currently active users, the main chat history area and the text input box. The application will use the master-slave architecture where a master node receiving a portion of data through the HTTP from one of the nodes shares it with the rest of the connected instances via the TCP socket connection. You will see how easy it can be implemented in Go. Go is a modern compiled and statically typed programming language developed and maintained by Google. The popularity of the language spiked dramatically over recent years consolidating 110k+ Github repositories for only 6 years of existence.

name: Workshop: Introduction to RxJS 5 in Angular 2 @ OK.ru
description_no_html: Hello everyone! We are happy to announce next event! Gerard Sans will introduce you to RxJS 5 in Angular 2 in practice! Bring your laptops with you, because its gonna be reactive :) What event is about? Angular 2 introduces a new Data Architecture based on Reactive Programming. RxJS 5 is a rewrite of Reactive Extensions focused on performance and usability. We are really excited to see the new approach using streams. We will cover a basic introduction to streams and RxJS 5 covering HTTP and Async Pipes.

name: #HashCode 2016 with GDG Riga and OK.ru
description_no_html: #HashCode is not an event alone, it’s a challenge! Do what it takes and compete with thousands of students and developers around the globe in trying to solve a complex, but fascinating real life problem. (See previous editions here:https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/past_editions.html) Hash Code started in 2014 as a one-day programming competition for students and professionals from across France. We introduced the Online Qualification Round in 2015 where more than 1,500 students and professionals competed. The top teams were then invited to the Google Paris office to face off in the Final Round of the competition. You can take a look at the problems and winning teams from past editions of Hash Code below. Work in a team of 2-4 students or IT professionals, get introduced to the problem by viewing live YouTube stream and start cracking! Are you up for the challenge? GDG Riga will host a dedicated Hub for #HashCode and provide all help and information you need to get into the competition. OK.ru will gladly provide a space for passionate developers to tease their brains. Additional Rules can be seen here:https://hashcode.withgoogle.com/rules.html

name: Workshop: Working with Google Maps on Android
description_no_html: If you are in need of a map integration within your app, then, most likely, you will try to use Google Maps. This workshop will try to explain usages and advantages of Google Maps and try to give a head start into the API. During the workshop, hosted by Valentine Paramonov (https://www.linkedin.com/in/valentin-paramonov-011632b2), we will develop an app that will use Google Maps API to tag and view your favorite photos and also try to brainstorm about possible extensions.

name: Writing web server on Go and breathing easily
description_no_html: We are happy to announce our next event! Maxim Sidorenko and Sergey Kibish will gently introduce you to Go language. They will guide you through moments of misunderstanding. You will feel again, that you can program and be calm, happy without losing a breath. During workshop you will write a web server which will be able to do simple stuff, then more complicated and so on. After workshop you will be able to write your own web app server on Go, easily. Join us on 19 of December at 12:00 in TechHub. Start good and lasting relationship with your new friend – Go programming language!

name: GDG Riga Meetup: Make you Project Stand Out!
description_no_html: It's been a while since our last meetup, but we are finally back from vacation! And this time we will try something a bit different. Every developer is a craftsmanship, but to be really succesful in addition to making wonders, you need to learn to have a silver tongue and know the tools and concepts of the market. We are honoured to have Ričards Lakučs, from Google, to introduce us to the ways how to make your product stand out and be popular: "How to show the world your product? How to reach out to the potential clients and how to actually find them in the first place? In this presentation, Google AdWords Strategist Ričards Lakučs will explain how to digitally market your products and services and how to achieve more using Google solutions. You will find out what is Google AdWords and what options you have to reach you clients locally and globally and what makes up a good digital strategy, how to identify your goals and reach them in the most efficient way."

name: Hackhathon: Getting started with AngularJS
description_no_html: Finally after one and a half year after GDG Riga founding we're finally hosting an AngularJS event by +Pavels Jelisejevs  (https://www.linkedin.com/in/jelisejev). During the course of this event, we will set up an AngularJS project and learn the basics of NG development. After an introductory section we'll hack in pairs on our own versions of an open API and finish off with a demo. There will be prizes!

name: GDG Riga: JUG Vilnius visit
description_no_html: Nobody argues these days that unit tests are useful and provide valuable feedback about your code. But who watches the watchmen? Let's talk about test code quality, code coverage and introduce mutation based testing techniques.

name: Google I/O Extended 2015: Riga
description_no_html: Join us at Google I/O Extended, watch a Keynote life stream, discuss the news and eat some snacks in the process. Friendly and Googly atmosphere guaranteed!

name: GDG Riga One Year Anniversary
description_no_html: 19.00 - 19.15 - "Retrospective of GDG Riga in 2014"(ENG) by +Alexey Buzdin 19.15 - 20.00 - "Innovations and the Digital World"(ENG) by +Vytautas Kubilius  from Google "I've been with Google for over 3 years now and had a chance to see how the organization works across different functions and countries. Today I'd love to share some interesting and relevant findings with GDG community that I believe will be very relevant to you. Many say Google is the most innovative company in the world - but what is innovation truly? How do you determine what to focus on? How do you innovate across a large organization? How do you successfully repeat the process over and over again?" 20.00 - 20.15 - Coffee Pause 20.15 - 21.00 - "Coolest Android gadgets of 2014!"(LAT) by +Kristaps Skutelis  from kursors.lv "In my speech I will take a look back at the best Android technologies and gadgets of 2014. Plus, I will share my own experience with these devices and give some information about local situation (availability) of these gadgets." 21.30 - Afterparty in a local pub (announced soon)

name: GDG Riga Meetup #01
description_no_html: Riga Dev Day has been a blast, but now we are back on track with monthly meetups. This time it will be a bit more official then usual: two great speakers, a cozy hotel and some late evening coffee.  Oh and did we mention cookies?

name: Java User Group: Android/GDG edition
description_no_html: If you ever dreamt of making mobile games, but wasn't sure where to start, now is your chance. In this event we will work with AndEngine, a open source Android game engine, to create a clone of a game you all know (and love). During the theoretical part, we'll cover all the basics: how to load game resources, put them on screen, and bring them to life. Be prepared: bring your own laptop with Android Studio pre-installed. Preferably, bring your Android device. But, to be completely sure the tooling works with it, make a new empty project in Android Studio and try to run it on the device at home. You are welcome to troubleshoot in the comments section of the event's G+ page.

name: AndEngine: Android 2D OpenGL Game Engine
description_no_html: If you ever dreamt of making mobile games, but wasn't sure where to start, now is your chance.[...]

name: iOS Workshop: Objective-C & SpriteKit
description_no_html: If you've always wanted to get into iOS development, but didn't know where to start, this is your chance. We'll show you how to set up the development environment and walk you through a simple project, from inception to putting it on the App Store! After we're done, you should be familiar will all the basic tools you need for making iOS apps, including up-to-date knowledge of Objective-C & SpriteKit. Be prepared: bring a Mac laptop, preferably with Xcode already installed. Don’t have a Mac? We'll pair you up with someone who does! If you want to test the result of your work on an actual iOS device, bring it as well.

name: GDG Riga Workshop: Elixir
description_no_html: Robustness of Erlang and elegance of Clojure, united in one language: that's Elixir. A functional, concurrent, and extensible programming language built atop BEAM, the Erlang virtual machine. For those not familiar with Erlang, this workshop will serve as an overview of the actor model and its applications to distributed systems, demonstrated on the Erlang platform. As for Erlang enthusiasts, Elixir just might patch up your heart, likely broken by Erlang's archaic syntax and OTP APIs. We'll start with a couple of introductory slides. As for the main part, we will work on a massively-collaborative, distributed graphics application (no spoilers). You will have some time to be creative, of course, and best ideas will be rewarded with usual GDG swag.

name: Workshop: Microsoft Azure Mobile Services
description_no_html: Want to create a cloud backend in a matter of minutes? We will learn how to use Node.js along with other cloud PaaS tools on Windows Azure platform, speed up development, and say goodbye to server side configuration hassle. All in a copuple easy scenarios. Find out how to create single sign-on with Active Directory, Facebook, Twitter, and Google with just a couple lines of code. And a lot of other things that make your development life easier. All demos will be prepeared for Node.js scenarios, but you are free to try out C# scenarios as well. We will also create a simple HTML5 client for the backend developed in this workshop, to see how hard or easy it is to use Azure Mobile services.

name: Hacklang Workshop @Riga
description_no_html: At this event we'll explore a new programming language from Facebook called Hack. Hack is based on PHP, but adds type annotations, generics, some null safety, async functions and other cool features. The task is to run a sample PHP program with Hack and then gradually refactor with new Hack features. At this time, only Vim and Emacs editors provide Hack syntax highlighting and are integrated with the Hack typechecker -- one of the most interesting features of Hack. Don't worry: there will be a Vim crash course and support during the event. We won't leave Vim beginners one on one with the infamous editor. :-)

name: Google I/O Extended: Conference Retrospective @Riga
description_no_html: Brought to you by GDG Riga, Google I/O Extended lets you experience the fun of Google I/O remotely. At this event we will take a look at all the new and shiny technologies from Google, such as Material Design, Android L and more. If you want to prepare yourself for the future, attendance is a must.

name: GDG Riga Coderetreat
description_no_html: Coderetreat is a day-long, intensive practice event, focusing on the fundamentals of software development and design. By providing developers the opportunity to take part in focused practice, away from the pressures of 'getting things done', the Coderetreat format has proven itself to be a highly effective means of skill improvement. Practicing the basic principles of modular and object-oriented design, developers can improve their ability to write code that minimizes the cost of change over time

name: Hackathon: Chrome Extensions
description_no_html: Do you want more control over your Chrome browser or Chromebook? Chrome Extensions make it possible. During the course of this event, we will set up a Chrome extension project and learn the basics of Chrome development. After an introductory section we'll hack in pairs on our own versions of a themed extension and finish off with a demo. There will be prizes!

name: GDG Riga: Androidify Yourself!
description_no_html: Haven’t looked into Android yet or just want to have some fun?  Join us on “Androidify Yourself”! During the event, we will take an overview of Android development and work with multiple Android APIs. To have a laugh, we will be creating a cool avatar generation app, with audio and social network integration. It is a great opportunity for you to get introduced to Android application lifecycle and its parts, and to get you on track on your own Android career. In preparation for the event, please, install Android Studio and Android SDK. Also make sure ADB recognizes your Android device if you plan to test your apps on it (some devices require some specific drivers).

name: Dart Flight School Riga
description_no_html: Dart helps you build modern web apps with a new language, core libraries, and tools such as a package manager, editor, and a compiler to JavaScript. Use Angular with Dart for extra jet fuel. Dart hit 1.0 and is now Flight Ready! Developer communities around the world are hosting Dart Flight School events, so we have decided that it would be nice to start GDG Riga events with Dart and Angular as well
